text:
Chromium: CVE-2023-4863 Heap buffer overflow in WebP 
Updated CVE detail with information regarding other Microsoft products affected by this vulnerability.  Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of the products listed in the CVE. 
Chromium: CVE-2023-4863 Heap buffer overflow in WebP 
On this page 
 
CVE-2023-4863 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Sep 12, 2023 Last updated: Nov 14, 2023 
Assigning CNA: 
Chrome 
CVE-2023-4863  
 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2023-4863 exists in the wild. 
The following table provides an  
exploitability assessment 
 for this vulnerability at the time of original publication. 
Publicly disclosed 
Exploited 
Exploitability assessment 
Yes 
Yes 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window 
Click on  
Help and Feedback 
Click on  
About Microsoft Edge 
How can I find out what version of Teams I am running? 
Click on the User Avatar at the top right of the Teams Windows. 
Click on  
About 
, then  
Version 
. 
The version will be displayed in the banner below the Search bar. 
Where do I get the latest version of Teams? 
The latest version of Microsoft Teams can be downloaded at  
https://teams.microsoft.com/download 
.

How can I find out what version of Skype I am running? 
Select the three dots (...) to the right of your avatar. 
Select  
Settings 
. 
Select  
Help & Feedback 
. 
The version will be displayed below the Skype logo. 
How do I get the updated Webp app? 
The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see  
here 
 for details. See  
Get updates for apps and games in Microsoft Store 
 for more information about how to get app updates. 
It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers. 
My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable? 
Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations. 
How can I check if the update is installed? 
App package versions 1.0.62681.0 and later contain this update. 
You can check the package version in PowerShell:  
Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.WebpImageExtension 
Microsoft recognizes the efforts of those in the security community who help us protect customers through coordinated vulnerability disclosure. See  
Acknowledgements 
 for more information. 
To determine the support lifecycle for your software, see the  
Microsoft Support Lifecycle 
.

metadata.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-4863 Heap buffer overflow in WebP
metadata.description: Updated CVE detail with information regarding other Microsoft products affected by this vulnerability.  Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of the products listed in the CVE.
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in WebP, identified as CVE-2023-4863. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is present in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Google has confirmed active exploitation of this vulnerability. Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to mitigate the risk. The latest versions of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) are 116.0.1938.81 and 117.0.2045.31, which address this vulnerability. Additionally, Microsoft Teams for Desktop, Microsoft Teams for Mac, Microsoft Skype, and WebP Image Extension are also affected and have received security updates. System administrators are advised to ensure the installation of the latest versions of these products to protect against exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
metadata.nvd_description: heap buffer overflow in libwebp in google chrome prior to 116.0.5845.187 and libwebp 1.3.2 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted html page. (chromium security severity: critical)
